document_title: Dragon worm disease: Causes, signs, treatment measures
subsection_name: benh-giun-rong.json_5_Complications if Dracunculus worm disease is not treated promptly
subsection_content:
When suffering from dragon worm disease and clinical symptoms appear, if not treated promptly, the disease can cause dangerous complications such as: cellulitis, abscess, septicemia, tetanus, and inflammation. infected joints, joint deformities,...
Up to now, the mortality rate from dragon worm disease is very low, but its complications can greatly affect the patient's life. Patients can be disabled for life due to superinfection. Dragon worm disease also affects the socio-economics as well as the health of the community due to complications.
